title: How to Spot Fake Gucci Bags

steps.title: Ask for images of the actual bag.
steps.content: Ask for images of the actual bag. That is, if it looks like the company is just using a stock image, request images of that bag specifically, especially if you are buying it used. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Look for sloppy stitching.
steps.content: Look for sloppy stitching. Gucci pays close attention to detail, so their stitching will be even and neat. If thread is pulling out or if it seems uneven on a bag, that bag is likely a fake. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Examine the back of the label.
steps.content: Examine the back of the label. The back of the label should have the serial hand-stamped on it. The letters should be small and close together. If they are widespread apart, it's likely a fake. [3] X Research source Also look for the copyright symbol (a circle with an R in it). The label should also have "Gucci" on it. Look specifically at the "u," which should be less bold on the right than the left. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Check the seams.
steps.content: Check the seams. Where seams meet, the pattern should line up precisely. Also, letters and logos won't be cut in half with the real thing. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Feel the leather.
steps.content: Feel the leather. The leather shouldn't be tough, but rather, soft and supple. Obviously, that is harder to see online, but in person, you should feel the leather. [6] X Research source On Gucci bags, the leather should be pebbled napa leather. Microsuede is a dead giveaway for a fake. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Look for glue lines.
steps.content: Look for glue lines. If you can see glue spilling out anywhere, it likely isn't a Gucci. Check where the different types of materials meet, and look at the lining inside for glue. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Check for rust.
steps.content: Check for rust. The metal on Gucci bags should not rust. Look closely at the places where the metal meets the leather or canvas. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Look for the sheen.
steps.content: Look for the sheen. Gucci bags are usually canvas. When you tilt them in the light, they should be lightly shiny. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Examine against the real thing.
steps.content: Examine against the real thing. That is, visit a store to see the real thing in person. Counterfeiters will often get parts of the bag wrong, especially on the inside, such as pocket locations or lining color. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Check for misspellings.
steps.content: Check for misspellings. Sometimes counterfeiters get words on the label wrong, so check to make sure words are spelled correctly. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Look at the "About Us" page.
steps.content: Look at the "About Us" page. Authenticate sites will have information on their store and a mission on their about me page. Authenticate sites are more likely to have the real thing. [13] X Research source Of course, fake stores can set up a fake "About Us" page. However, if it's missing, it's a giveaway of a low-quality store.

steps.title: Read the "Frequently Asked Questions" page.
steps.content: Read the "Frequently Asked Questions" page. They should offer reassurances about the authenticity of their bags, as well as answer questions you have about the bags. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Look for the phrase "guaranteed authentic Gucci bag."
steps.content: Look for the phrase "guaranteed authentic Gucci bag." Don't be fooled by other phrases such as "guaranteed original." [15] X Research source

steps.title: Check out how many listings they have.
steps.content: Check out how many listings they have. A seller with thousands of listings is not likely selling real Gucci bags. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Examine whether it's a site with one seller.
steps.content: Examine whether it's a site with one seller. Sites such as Amazon and eBay feature multiple sellers, so it's more difficult to tell if you have a quality seller. [17] X Research source You can still find real Gucci bags on these sites. You just need to be more careful about who you buy from.

steps.title: Skip the roadside stands.
steps.content: Skip the roadside stands. Bags being hawked on the side of the road are not likely to be the real thing.

steps.title: Consider the price.
steps.content: Consider the price. If the bag your buying is considerably cheaper than a similar item on another site, it's likely fake. [18] X Research source
